Package kentico.kontent.delivery

Class DeliveryClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • kentico.kontent.delivery.DeliveryClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    public class DeliveryClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable
    Executes requests against the Kentico Kontent Delivery API.
    See Also:
    KenticoKontent API reference - Authentication, KenticoKontent API reference - Delivery API

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      DeliveryClient​(java.lang.String projectId)
      Initializes a new instance of the DeliveryClient class for retrieving content of the specified project.

      Initializes a new instance of the DeliveryClient class for retrieving content of the specified project, and configures the preview API.

      Initializes a new instance of the DeliveryClient class for retrieving content of the specified project.
      DeliveryClient​(DeliveryOptions deliveryOptions, TemplateEngineConfig templateEngineConfig)
      Initializes a new instance of the DeliveryClient class for retrieving content of the specified project.

                      TemplateEngineConfig templateEngineConfig)

        Parameters:

        templateEngineConfig - Configuration object used for customization of template render engines for inline content

      • DeliveryClient

        public DeliveryClient​(java.lang.String projectId)
        Initializes a new instance of the DeliveryClient class for retrieving content of the specified project.
        Parameters:
        projectId - The Project ID associated with your Kentico Kontent account. Must be in the format of an UUID.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the Project id is invalid.

      • DeliveryClient

        public DeliveryClient​(java.lang.String projectId,
                      java.lang.String previewApiKey)
        Initializes a new instance of the DeliveryClient class for retrieving content of the specified project, and configures the preview API.

        An API key (which comes in the form of a verified JSON Web Token) provides read-only access to a single project. You can find the API keys for your project in the API keys section in the Kentico Kontent app.

        Parameters:
        projectId - The Project ID associated with your Kentico Kontent account. Must be in the format of an UUID.
        previewApiKey - The Preview API key configured with your Kentico Kontent account.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the Project id is invalid.

    • Method Detail

      • getItems

        public ContentItemsListingResponse getItems()
        Returns a ContentItemsListingResponse for all items in the project. Beware, this is an incredibly expensive operation on a big project, you were forewarned.
        Returns:
        A ContentItemsListingResponse for all items in the project.
        Throws:
        KenticoIOException - If an IOException is thrown interacting with KenticoKontent.
        See Also:
        ContentItem, ContentItemsListingResponse, KenticoKontent API reference - List content items

      • getItems

        public ContentItemsListingResponse getItems​(java.util.List<NameValuePair> params)
        Returns a ContentItemsListingResponse using the query provided. For simplicity, it is recommended to use DeliveryParameterBuilder.params() followed by DeliveryParameterBuilder.build() to generate the query parameters.
        Parameters:
        params - The query parameters to use for this listing request.
        Returns:
        A ContentItemsListingResponse for items matching the query parameters.
        Throws:
        KenticoIOException - If an IOException is thrown interacting with KenticoKontent.
        See Also:
        DeliveryParameterBuilder, ContentItem, ContentItemsListingResponse, KenticoKontent API reference - Listing response, KenticoKontent API reference - List content items

      • getItems

        public <T> java.util.List<T> getItems​(java.lang.Class<T> tClass,
                                      java.util.List<NameValuePair> params)
        Returns a new instance of List<T> by mapping fields to elements from a ContentItemsListingResponse using the query provided. For simplicity, it is recommended to use DeliveryParameterBuilder.params() followed by DeliveryParameterBuilder.build() to generate the query parameters. For performance reasons, if there are is a System.type registered with T, then the 'system.type=YOUR_TYPE' query parameter will be added automatically if 'system.type' is not part of the query.

        Element fields are mapped by automatically CamelCasing and checking for equality, unless otherwise annotated by an ElementMapping annotation. T must have a default constructor and have standard setter methods.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of class.
        Parameters:
        tClass - The class which a new instance should be returned from.
        params - The query parameters to use for this listing request.
        Returns:
        An instance of List<T> with data mapped from the ContentItem list in this response.
        Throws:
        KenticoIOException - If an IOException is thrown interacting with KenticoKontent
        See Also:
        DeliveryParameterBuilder, ContentItemsListingResponse.castTo(Class), ContentItemMapping, ElementMapping, registerType(Class), registerType(String, Class)

      • getItem

        public ContentItemResponse getItem​(java.lang.String contentItemCodename)
        Returns a ContentItemResponse for the ContentItem in the project with the given System.codename.
        Parameters:
        contentItemCodename - The System.getCodename() for the ContentItem requested.
        Returns:
        A ContentItemResponse for the ContentItem in the project.
        Throws:
        KenticoIOException - If an IOException is thrown connecting to Kentico.
        See Also:
        ContentItem, ContentItemResponse, KenticoKontent API reference - View a content item

      • getItems

        public <T> java.util.List<T> getItems​(java.lang.Class<T> tClass)
        Returns a new instance of List<T> by mapping fields to elements from a ContentItemsListingResponse. Beware, this is an incredibly expensive operation on a big project, you were forewarned. It is recommended to use getItems(Class, List) using a DeliveryParameterBuilder instead. For performance reasons, if there are is a System.type registered with T, then the 'system.type=YOUR_TYPE' query parameter will be added automatically.

        Element fields are mapped by automatically CamelCasing and checking for equality, unless otherwise annotated by an ElementMapping annotation. T must have a default constructor and have standard setter methods.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of class.
        Parameters:
        tClass - The class which a new instance should be returned from.
        Returns:
        An instance of List<T> with data mapped from the ContentItem list in this response.
        Throws:
        KenticoIOException - If an IOException is thrown interacting with KenticoKontent.
        See Also:
        DeliveryParameterBuilder, ContentItemsListingResponse.castTo(Class), ContentItemMapping, ElementMapping, registerType(Class), registerType(String, Class)

      • getPageOfItems

        public <T> Page<T> getPageOfItems​(java.lang.Class<T> tClass,
                                  java.util.List<NameValuePair> params)
        Returns Page containing a new instance of List<T> by mapping fields to elements from a ContentItemsListingResponse using the query provided. For simplicity, it is recommended to use DeliveryParameterBuilder.params() followed by DeliveryParameterBuilder.build() to generate the query parameters.

        Element fields are mapped by automatically CamelCasing and checking for equality, unless otherwise annotated by an ElementMapping annotation. T must have a default constructor and have standard setter methods.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of class.
        Parameters:
        tClass - The class which a new instance should be returned from.
        params - The query parameters to use for this listing request.
        Returns:
        An instance of Page<T> with data mapped from the ContentItem list in this response.
        Throws:
        KenticoIOException - If an IOException is thrown interacting with KenticoKontent.
        See Also:
        Page, Pagination, DeliveryParameterBuilder, ContentItemsListingResponse.castTo(Class), ContentItemMapping, ElementMapping, registerType(Class), registerType(String, Class), KenticoKontent API reference - Listing response paging

      • getItem

        public <T> T getItem​(java.lang.String contentItemCodename,
                     java.lang.Class<T> tClass)
        Returns new instance of T by mapping fields to elements from a ContentItem in the project with the given System.codename.

        Element fields are mapped by automatically CamelCasing and checking for equality, unless otherwise annotated by an ElementMapping annotation. T must have a default constructor and have standard setter methods.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of class.
        Parameters:
        tClass - The class which a new instance should be returned from.
        contentItemCodename - The System.getCodename() for the ContentItem requested.
        Returns:
        An instance of Page<T> with data mapped from the ContentItem list in this response.
        Throws:
        KenticoIOException - If an IOException is thrown interacting with KenticoKontent.
        See Also:
        ContentItem, ContentItemResponse.castTo(Class), ContentItemMapping, ElementMapping, registerType(Class), registerType(String, Class), KenticoKontent API reference - View a content item

      • getItem

        public ContentItemResponse getItem​(java.lang.String contentItemCodename,
                                   java.util.List<NameValuePair> params)
        Returns a ContentItemResponse for the ContentItem in the project with the given System.codename. Query parameters can be provided, which can be used to change linked item depth or to apply a projection. For simplicity, it is recommended to use DeliveryParameterBuilder.params() followed by DeliveryParameterBuilder.build() to generate the query parameters.
        Parameters:
        contentItemCodename - The System.codename for the ContentItem requested.
        params - The query parameters to use for this ContentItemResponse request.
        Returns:
        A ContentItemResponse for the ContentItem in the project.
        Throws:
        KenticoIOException - If an IOException is thrown connecting to Kentico.
        See Also:
        DeliveryParameterBuilder, ContentItem, ContentItemResponse, KenticoKontent API reference - View a content item, KenticoKontent API reference - Listing response

      • getItem

        public <T> T getItem​(java.lang.String contentItemCodename,
                     java.lang.Class<T> tClass,
                     java.util.List<NameValuePair> params)
        Returns new instance of T by mapping fields to elements from a ContentItem in the project with the given System.codename. Query parameters can be provided, which can be used to change linked item depth or to apply a projection. For simplicity, it is recommended to use DeliveryParameterBuilder.params() followed by DeliveryParameterBuilder.build() to generate the query parameters.

        Element fields are mapped by automatically CamelCasing and checking for equality, unless otherwise annotated by an ElementMapping annotation. T must have a default constructor and have standard setter methods.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of class.
        Parameters:
        contentItemCodename - The System.getCodename() for the ContentItem requested.
        tClass - The class which a new instance should be returned from.
        params - The query parameters to use for this ContentItemResponse request.
        Returns:
        An instance of Page<T> with data mapped from the ContentItem list in this response.
        Throws:
        KenticoIOException - If an IOException is thrown interacting with KenticoKontent.
        See Also:
        ContentItem, ContentItemResponse.castTo(Class), ContentItemMapping, ElementMapping, registerType(Class), registerType(String, Class), KenticoKontent API reference - View a content item

      • getTypes

        public ContentTypesListingResponse getTypes()
        Returns a ContentTypesListingResponse detailing all ContentTypes in the project.
        Returns:
        A ContentTypesListingResponse containing all ContentTypes in the project.
        Throws:
        KenticoIOException - If an IOException is thrown interacting with KenticoKontent.
        See Also:
        ContentType, getTypes(), getTypes(List), KenticoKontent API reference - List content types, KenticoKontent API reference - Content type object

      • getTypes

        public ContentTypesListingResponse getTypes​(java.util.List<NameValuePair> params)
        Returns a ContentTypesListingResponse detailing all ContentTypes in the project. Query parameters can be provided, which can be used for paging. For simplicity, it is recommended to use DeliveryParameterBuilder.params() followed by DeliveryParameterBuilder.build() to generate the query parameters.
        Parameters:
        params - The query parameters to use for this ContentItemResponse request.
        Returns:
        A ContentTypesListingResponse containing a page or all ContentTypes.
        Throws:
        KenticoIOException - If an IOException is thrown interacting with KenticoKontent.
        See Also:
        Pagination, ContentType, KenticoKontent API reference - List content types, KenticoKontent API reference - Content type object

      • getType

        public ContentType getType​(java.lang.String contentTypeCodeName)
        Returns the ContentType with a System.codename.
        Parameters:
        contentTypeCodeName - The System.codename for the ContentType request.
        Returns:
        The ContentType matching System.codename.

        KenticoIOException - If an IOException is thrown interacting with KenticoKontent.

      • getContentTypeElement

        public Element getContentTypeElement​(java.lang.String contentTypeCodeName,
                                     java.lang.String elementCodeName)
        Retrieve a specific ContentType Element by specifying its codename and its parent content type.
        Parameters:
        contentTypeCodeName - The System.codename for the ContentType request.
        elementCodeName - The codename for the Element.
        Returns:
        The Element for the ContentType requested.
        See Also:
        KenticoKontent API reference - View a content type element, KenticoKontent API reference - Content element model

      • getContentTypeElement

        public Element getContentTypeElement​(java.lang.String contentTypeCodeName,
                                     java.lang.String elementCodeName,
                                     java.util.List<NameValuePair> params)
        Retrieve a specific ContentType Element by specifying its codename and its parent content type. Generally you will want to use getContentTypeElement(String, String) instead, but this allows specification of query parameters.
        Parameters:
        contentTypeCodeName - The System.codename for the ContentType request.
        elementCodeName - The codename for the Element.
        params - Query params to add to the request.
        Returns:
        The Element for the ContentType requested.
        See Also:
        getContentTypeElement(String, String), KenticoKontent API reference - View a content type element, KenticoKontent API reference - Content element model

      • getTaxonomyGroups

        public TaxonomyGroupListingResponse getTaxonomyGroups()
        Retrieve all TaxonomyGroup in your project. Returns them ordered alphabetically by codename.
        Returns:
        A response object containing all TaxonomyGroup in the project.
        See Also:
        TaxonomyGroup, Taxonomy, KenticoKontent API reference - List taxonomy groups, KenticoKontent API reference - Taxonomy group model

      • getTaxonomyGroups

        public TaxonomyGroupListingResponse getTaxonomyGroups​(java.util.List<NameValuePair> params)
        Retrieve a page of TaxonomyGroup in your project. Use DeliveryParameterBuilder.page(Integer, Integer).
        Parameters:
        params - Built from DeliveryParameterBuilder.page(Integer, Integer)
        Returns:
        A response object containing all TaxonomyGroup in the project.
        See Also:
        TaxonomyGroup, Taxonomy, KenticoKontent API reference - List taxonomy groups, KenticoKontent API reference - Taxonomy group model

      • getTaxonomyGroup

        public TaxonomyGroup getTaxonomyGroup​(java.lang.String taxonomyGroupCodename)
        Retrieve a specific TaxonomyGroup from your project by specifying its codename.
        Parameters:
        taxonomyGroupCodename - The codename of a specfic taxonomy group.
        Returns:
        The TaxonomyGroup.
        See Also:
        TaxonomyGroup, Taxonomy, KenticoKontent API reference - View a taxonomy group, KenticoKontent API reference - Taxonomy group model

      • getTaxonomyGroup

        public TaxonomyGroup getTaxonomyGroup​(java.lang.String taxonomyGroupCodename,
                                      java.util.List<NameValuePair> params)
        Retrieve a specific TaxonomyGroup from your project by specifying its codename. Generally you will want to use getTaxonomyGroup(String) instead, but this allows specification of query parameters.
        Parameters:
        taxonomyGroupCodename - The codename of a specfic taxonomy group.
        params - Query params to add to the request.
        Returns:
        The TaxonomyGroup.
        See Also:
